name: BorrowerAssessment
label: borrower assessment
definition: assessment report detailing information about the borrower and their credit history that may be relevant to the loan application
explanatoryNote: Includes credit rating information. Ongoing assessment reports both good and bad credit rating information. In the US, by regulation, lender is required to respot person's payment history on a monthly basis. This is the basis on which peope's score is changed. So the lender's reporting to the credit bureau may affect that person's credit rating. this may give rise to credit disputes. Also there is a scenario where the borrower may contact the lender and ask for some change. For student loans, they can apply for a deferment payment based on change in circumstances e.g. if losing job, or becoming disabled, then there are specific programs which they can apply for. can defer paymen for a time, and if proven eligible (e.g. also if in military, being deployed), then if they subbut the relevant document, they approve and change their repayment term, perhaps temporarily and then revert to the previously agreed terms. This results from the borrower contacting the lender.

name: PreApprovalContract
explanatoryNote: A commitment from a lender to a borrower to extend a home purchase loan up to a certain amount, and subject to certain non-credit related conditions.  This commitment is entered into after a comprehensive analysis of the credit worthiness of the borrower is carried out.
label: pre-approval contract
definition: written commitment to lend when specified conditions are met, such as finding suitable property, and unchanged creditworthiness

name: PreApprovalRequest
explanatoryNote: This may also include limits on the region where to purchase.
definition: request from a potential borrower that a lender commit to pre-approving the borrower for a loan of up to a specified amount of money
label: pre-approval request

name: CreditRiskAssessment
definition: risk assessment that focuses on determining the likelihood of a potential borrower repaying a loan
label: credit risk assessment

name: IndividualPersonCreditRating
definition: credit rating that provides an opinion of the creditworthiness of a person
label: individual person credit rating

name: LoanApplication
label: loan application
definition: request by a potential borrower to a potential lender to borrow money containing information used to decide whether to grant the loan

name: PublicRecord
explanatoryNote: This can include court actions such as bankruptcy and foreclosure, as well as liens and other events that have been recorded.
definition: record about an action involving a party that is publicly available from a court or other government agency
label: public record

name: AllBorrowersMonthlyIncome
label: all borrowers' monthly income
definition: total monthly qualifying income for all borrowers on the loan

name: UnderwritingAutomation
label: underwriting automation
definition: classifier indicating whether a loan was underwritten manually or using an automated underwriting system

name: IncomeVerificationReport
label: income verification report
definition: report providing the methodology and supporting documentation used to verify the borrower's income

name: UnderwritingDecision
definition: classifier providing a loan approval recommendation determined either manually or by an automated underwriting system
label: underwriting decision

name: BorrowerMonthlyIncome
label: borrower monthly income
definition: total monthly qualifying income of a potential borrower

name: PublicRecordCategory
label: public record category
definition: classifier of public records relevant to a loan application, e.g. tax lien, wage garnishment, foreclosure

name: TotalDebtExpenseRatio
label: total debt expense ratio
definition: ratio of all monthly debt payments of all borrowers, including proposed expenses, with respect to the income of the borrowers as relied upon to make a credit decision

name: DenialReason-InsufficientCash
label: insufficient cash
definition: The application was denied due to insufficient down payment, or cash available to pay closing costs.

name: DenialReason-CreditApplicationIncomplete
definition: The application was denied because the credit application was not complete.
label: credit application incomplete

name: DenialReason-InsufficientCreditHistory
definition: The application was denied because the credit history was too limited, unacceptable, or not at sufficient standing.
label: insufficient credit history

name: isPreApprovalRequested
definition: indicates whether a pre-approval has been requested, in conjunction with a loan application
label: is pre-approval requested

name: AutomaticUnderwriting
label: automatic underwriting
definition: underwriting was performed using an automated underwriting system

name: DenialReason-MortgageInsuranceDenied
label: mortgage insurance denied
definition: The application was denied because necessary mortgage insurance was denied.

name: hasRequestedAmount
label: has requested amount
definition: relates something, e.g. a request for a loan, to the amount of funds requested

name: DenialReason-InsufficientCollateralValue
definition: The application was denied because the value or type of collateral was not sufficient.
label: insufficient collateral value

name: hasApplicationDate
definition: date on which an application was signed and submitted
label: has application date

name: DenialReason-InsufficientEmploymentHistory
definition: The application was denied because the employment is irregular, unknown, or not sufficient.
label: insufficient employment history

name: DenialReason-InsufficientIncome
label: insufficient income
definition: The application was denied because the debt to income ratio is too high.

name: hasIntendedLoanPurpose
label: has intended loan purpose
definition: indicates the purpose to which the loaned funds are to be put

name: DenialReason-UnverifiableInformation
definition: The application was denied because qualification information such as income, employment, credit, or residence) was not verifiable.
label: unverifiable information

name: hasApplicationPhase
definition: The phase within the application lifecycle, that this Loan Application is at,
label: has application phase

name: hasGrossIncome
definition: indicates the personal gross income of the borrower
label: has gross income

name: usesFactor
explanatoryNote: There is intentionally no range for this property, so as not to limit what can be used as a factor. Often it will be a measure such as borrower monthly income. Thus, having a class called Factor seems unhelpful.
definition: relates e.g. a risk assessment to something used as a factor to make the assessment
label: uses factor

name: hasOriginalLoanDebtToIncomeRatio
definition: indicates the debt-to-income (DTI) ratio at the time when the loan was advanced; for combined income
label: has original loan debt-to-income ratio

name: hasApprovedAmount
definition: relates something, e.g. a loan, to the amount of funds approved
label: has approved amount

name: ManualUnderwriting
label: manual underwriting
definition: underwriting was performed manually
